example.name: sync_notion_task_to_github
example.description: Sync a new Notion task to GitHub as an issue and assign it automatically.
example.context: When a project manager creates a task in Notion.
example.explanation: This creates a GitHub issue from a Notion task and assigns it to the selected user.

example.name: sync_github_issue_to_notion
example.description: Update Notion when a GitHub issue is closed.
example.context: When a developer closes an issue in GitHub.
example.explanation: This updates the corresponding Notion task to mark it as completed.

example.name: automatic_assignment
example.description: Assign a task based on user availability and role.
example.context: When a new task is created and needs assignment.
example.code: def assign_task(task): assignee = select_user(task) update_github_issue(task['github_id'], assignee) update_notion_task(task['notion_id'], assignee)
example.explanation: This pattern ensures tasks are assigned efficiently in both platforms.
